data.title: 100 Easy General Knowledge Questions and Answers: 2024 Edition
data.meta_description: Explore our blog for a wide range of easy-to-understand general knowledge questions and answers, perfect for all ages and interests.
data.text:
In the dynamic world of today, keeping up with general knowledge questions has become a cornerstone of everyday conversation and self-improvement. Whether it's a casual discussion with friends or a competitive quiz, general knowledge questions are everywhere. This is why we have meticulously prepared this comprehensive guide of 100 easy general knowledge questions and answers, specifically tailored for the 2024 audience. Our aim is to equip you with a broad spectrum of information, ranging from historical facts to current global events. This list of general knowledge questions and answers is more than just a compilation; it's a gateway to becoming more informed and confident in various subjects. So, whether you're a trivia enthusiast, a student preparing for a quiz, or simply someone who loves acquiring new knowledge, these general knowledge questions are designed to be engaging, insightful, and accessible to everyone.

Here's a list of 100 general knowledge questions divided into five categories, each with 20 questions and their answers.

Also, for more such blogs, visit Education Nest!

Category 1: Geography General Knowledge Questions

What is the capital of Canada?

Answer: Ottawa.

What is the longest river in the world?

Answer: The Nile.

Which desert is the largest in the world?

Answer: The Sahara Desert.

What country has the most natural lakes?

Answer: Canada.

In which continent is the Amazon Rainforest located?

Answer: South America.

What is the smallest country in the world?

Answer: Vatican City.

Mount Everest is located in which mountain range?

Answer: The Himalayas.

What is the capital city of Australia?

Answer: Canberra.

Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?

Answer: Japan.

The Great Barrier Reef is off the coast of which Australian state?

Answer: Queensland.

What is the longest river in the USA?

Answer: The Missouri River.

Which U.S. state is known as the "Sunshine State"?

Answer: Florida.

What is the capital of Italy?

Answer: Rome.

What is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea?

Answer: Sicily.

Which country is Prague in?

Answer: Czech Republic.

What river runs through Baghdad?

Answer: Tigris River.

What is the largest country in Africa by area?

Answer: Algeria.

Which two countries share the longest international border?

Answer: Canada and the United States.

What city is the Statue of Liberty in?

Answer: New York City.

What is the capital of New Zealand?

Answer: Wellington.

Category 2: History General Knowledge Questions

Who was the first President of the United States?

Answer: George Washington.

In which year did the Titanic sink?

Answer: 1912.

Who wrote the Declaration of Independence?

Answer: Thomas Jefferson.

What was the name of the first man-made satellite to orbit the Earth?

Answer: Sputnik.

Which war ended with the Treaty of Versailles in 1919?

Answer: World War I.

Who was known as the 'Maid of Orleans'?

Answer: Joan of Arc.

What ancient civilization built the Machu Picchu complex in Peru?

Answer: The Incas.

Who discovered penicillin?

Answer: Alexander Fleming.

The Great Wall of China was primarily built by which dynasty?

Answer: The Ming Dynasty.

Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize (in 1903)?

Answer: Marie Curie.

What year did the Berlin Wall fall?

Answer: 1989.

Which country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the United States?

Answer: France.

Who was the Egyptian queen who had a relationship with Roman generals Julius Caesar and Mark Antony?

Answer: Cleopatra.

When did the Roman Empire fall?

Answer: 476 AD.

Who was the first emperor of China?

Answer: Qin Shi Huang.

What year did the United States declare independence?

Answer: 1776.

In which country did the Industrial Revolution begin?

Answer: Great Britain.

Who was the leader of the Nazi Party?

Answer: Adolf Hitler.

Which famous leader was assassinated by his friend Brutus?

Answer: Julius Caesar.

Who was the first human to journey into space?

Answer: Yuri Gagarin.

Category 3: Sports General Knowledge Questions and Answers

What is the national sport of Japan?

Answer: Sumo Wrestling.

Which country won the first ever FIFA World Cup in 1930?

Answer: Uruguay.

Who holds the record for the most Grand Slam titles in tennis?

Answer: Margaret Court.

What is the highest possible score in a single frame of bowling?

Answer: 30 points.

In what year were women first allowed to participate in the modern Olympic Games?

Answer: 1900.

Which sport is known as the 'king of sports'?

Answer: Soccer (Football).

Who is known as the fastest man in the world?

Answer: Usain Bolt.

What sport is played at Wimbledon?

Answer: Tennis.

How many players are there in a rugby league team?

Answer: 13 players.

What is the term used when a golfer scores one under par on a hole?

Answer: Birdie.

In baseball, what is it called when a batter gets three strikes?

Answer: A strikeout.

What is the only sport to be played on the moon?

Answer: Golf.

What sport is known as 'America's pastime'?

Answer: Baseball.

Which country invented table tennis?

Answer: England.

What is the maximum number of clubs a golfer is allowed in their bag during a round?

Answer: 14 clubs.

In basketball, how many points is a shot from beyond the three-point line worth?

Answer: Three points.

Which country hosts the annual Formula One Grand Prix in the city of Monaco?

Answer: Monaco.

What color are the goalposts in American football?

Answer: Yellow.

What is the national sport of Canada?

Answer: Lacrosse (summer) and Ice Hockey (winter).

In which sport would you perform the Fosbury Flop?

Answer: High Jump.

Category 4: Films and Entertainment

Which movie won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2023?

Answer: Everything Everywhere All at Once

Who stars as the lead character in the 2021 film 'Dune'?

Answer: Timothée Chalamet.

What is the name of the 2020 Netflix documentary about Joe Exotic?

Answer: Tiger King.

Which artist won the Grammy for Album of the Year in 2022?

Answer: Jon Batiste

Which 2022 film is based on the story of the Williams sisters' early years and their father's coaching?

Answer: King Richard.

Who hosted the Academy Awards in 2023?

Answer: Jimmy Kimmel

What is the title of the 2021 James Bond film, Daniel Craig's last appearance as Bond?

Answer: No Time to Die.

Which movie won the Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture - Drama in 2022?

Answer: The Fabelmans

Who played the lead role in the 2021 film 'The Batman'?

Answer: Robert Pattinson.

What is the name of the Disney+ series, released in 2021, featuring the Marvel character Loki?

Answer: Loki.

Which Korean series on Netflix became a global phenomenon in 2021?

Answer: Squid Game.

What is the name of the 2023 biopic film about Elvis Presley?

Answer: Elvis.

Which film won the Palme d'Or at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival?

Answer: Ruben Ostlund's 'Triangle of Sadness' Wins Palme d'Or at 2022 Cannes Film Festival.

Who performed the halftime show at the 2022 Super Bowl?

Answer: Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar.

What is the title of the 2021 sequel to 'A Quiet Place'?

Answer: A Quiet Place Part II.

Who won the Emmy for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series in 2022?

Answer: Zendaya

Which animated film won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature in 2023?

Answer: 'Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio' wins best animated feature.

Which 2020 film, directed by Chloé Zhao, won the Oscar for Best Picture?

Answer: Nomadland.

Who played the character of Geralt of Rivia in the Netflix series 'The Witcher'?

Answer: Henry Cavill.

What film did Bong Joon-ho direct in 2019 that won multiple Oscars in 2020, including Best Picture?

Answer: Parasite.

Category 5: Current Affairs

Who won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2021?

Answer: Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov.

Which country hosted the 2022 FIFA World Cup?

Answer: Qatar.

What was the name of the Mars rover that NASA landed on Mars in 2021?

Answer: Perseverance.

Which country announced its plans to build the world's first city on Mars by 2054?

Answer: United Arab Emirates.

Who became the Prime Minister of Israel in 2021?

Answer: Naftali Bennett.

What is the name of the global climate summit held in Glasgow in 2021?

Answer: COP26.

Which country won the most medals at the 2021 Tokyo Olympics?

Answer: United States.

Who was elected as the President of Germany in 2022?

Answer: Frank-Walter Steinmeier (re-elected).

What new variant of COVID-19 emerged in late 2021, causing global concern?

Answer: Omicron.

Which Asian country declared a state of emergency in 2021 due to the economic crisis?

Answer: Sri Lanka.

Which film won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2022?

Answer: CODA.

In 2021, which country became the first in the world to accept Bitcoin as legal tender?

Answer: El Salvador.

What significant space event was accomplished by China in 2021?

Answer: China's rover Zhurong landed on Mars.

Who was sworn in as the 46th President of the United States in 2021?

Answer: Joe Biden.

Which country announced it would phase out the sale of new petrol and diesel cars by 2030?

Answer: United Kingdom.

In 2022, which tennis player was deported from Australia due to vaccination status issues?

Answer: Novak Djokovic.

What major sporting event was postponed from 2020 to 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic?

Answer: Tokyo Summer Olympics.

Which country officially withdrew its troops from Afghanistan in 2021, ending a 20-year military presence?

Answer: United States.

What major breakthrough in science was reported in 2021 regarding a malaria vaccine?

Answer: WHO endorsed the first malaria vaccine, RTS,S/AS01 (Mosquirix).

Which Asian country successfully tested a hypersonic missile in 2021?

Answer: North Korea.

Frequently Asked Questions about General Knowledge

Q: What are some current trending topics in general knowledge?

A: Current trending topics in general knowledge include recent advancements in technology, major political events, environmental issues, and cultural developments worldwide.

Q: How can I improve my general knowledge quickly?

A: To improve your general knowledge quickly, regularly read newspapers, follow credible news sources, engage in quizzes, and explore various subjects like history, science, and arts.

Q: Are general knowledge questions useful for competitive exams?

A: Yes, general knowledge questions are incredibly useful for competitive exams as they often include sections on current affairs, history, and general awareness.

Q: Can general knowledge questions help in personal development?

A: Absolutely, general knowledge questions can significantly aid in personal development by broadening one’s understanding of the world, improving cognitive abilities, and enhancing social interaction skills.

Q: What are some reliable sources for updating general knowledge?

A: Reliable sources for updating general knowledge include quality newspapers, educational websites, academic journals, and government publications.

Q: How often should one update their general knowledge?

A: One should ideally update their general knowledge regularly, if possible on a daily basis, to stay informed about the latest developments and discoveries.

Q: Are there any apps or websites specifically for learning general knowledge?

A: Yes, there are numerous apps and websites dedicated to general knowledge, offering quizzes, articles, and interactive learning tools.

Q: Is watching the news a good way to improve general knowledge?

A: Watching the news is a great way to improve general knowledge, as it provides updates on current events, international affairs, and other important information.

Q: What role does general knowledge play in career advancement?

A: General knowledge plays a significant role in career advancement by enhancing decision-making skills, keeping you informed about industry trends, and improving your ability to engage in diverse professional discussions.

Q: Can general knowledge questions help in improving memory and cognitive skills?
